citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: Subsurface Mooring Data from Chiniak Bay, Gulf of Alaska: Station Chiniak Bay 1

descript.abstract: Subsurface mooring data from Chiniak Bay, Gulf of Alaska: Station Chiniak Bay 1. Data were collected from 1994 through 2004. Sampled months varied through the years but were usually during January, February, March, April, May, and October. Salinity, temperature, and UV vector data were collected at various depths throughout the years using instruments such as MicroCAT, MTR. RCM-7, RCM-9, and SEACAT. 190m was the maximum bottom depth.
descript.purpose: To collect physical oceanographic properties at and near the mooring locations.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
